DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : Previous study demonstrate abdominal obesity predictive ischemic heart disease . These prospective cohort study employ simple index body-fat distribution waist-to-hip circumference ratio subscapular skinfold . Their similar result suggest increased abdominal obesity confer two-fold increase risk ischemic heart disease among middle-aged men . The two proposed study permit test alternative fat-distribution index might strong risk factor ischemic heart disease incidence waist-to-hip-ratio subscapular skinfold . DESIGN NARRATIVE : Two parallel case-control study conduct . In study , subject measure girth , skinfold , abdominal sagittal diameter , height , weight . Analyses protocol consider men woman separately . Possible confounders association fat-distribution index ischemic heart disease consider require , adjust multivariate analysis . Possible confounders include race , age , tobacco use , alcohol use , diabetes , social class , hypertension , cholesterol level , physical activity level .
